channel.title: PI switching
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCvTq0UqUy4&feature=plcp
that's basically the problem, if you switch an item in a certain spot in the inventory it'll bring it back to the top row of the inventory It didn't do it before, someone I was coding with messed with the source and I have no idea where to go about fixing this. If someone can point me in the direction of where. Thanks in advance.

item.title: PI switching
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X

I thought it was supposed to do that by default.
[/quote]

At first It didn’t.
Not sure what he did to revert it back to this. But it’s confusing trying to fix it.[/quote]

PM me your skype or teamviewer details.

item.title: PI switching
item.dc:creator: @hi_im_bamf hi im bamf
item.description:
@hi_im_bamf wrote:

I followed that, and a friend tried helping me. I couldn’t fix it.

public void setEquipment(int wearID, int amount, int targetSlot) { synchronized(c) { c.getOutStream().createFrameVarSizeWord(34); c.getOutStream().writeWord(1688); c.getOutStream().writeByte(targetSlot); c.getOutStream().writeWord(wearID+1); if (amount > 254) { c.getOutStream().writeByte(255); c.getOutStream().writeDWord(amount); } else { c.getOutStream().writeByte(amount); } c.getOutStream().endFrameVarSizeWord(); c.flushOutStream(); c.playerEquipment[targetSlot]=wearID; c.playerEquipmentN[targetSlot]=amount; c.updateRequired = true; c.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true); } }

That’s how I changed it, is that incorrect? cause it seems fine to me.

Read full topic
